DOC.detailed_description: The patient study plan Percutaneous Coronary Intervention ( PCI ) recanalization Chronic Total Occlusion ( CTO ) clinical ground alone . This study record pressure wire reading block narrowed artery , good guide treatment option . To date data available instantaneous wave free ratio ( iFR ) measurement ( pressure derive assessment flow limitation ) patient blocked artery .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age > 18 year age 2 . Stable angina / ischaemic symptom 3 . Evidence viability / ischaemia chronic total occlusion ( CTO ) territory 4 . Participant willing able give inform consent participation study 5 . Presence chronic total occlusion ( CTO ) RCA : Duration occlusion > 3 month ; Thrombolysis In Myocardial Infarction ( TIMI ) ( 50 ) coronary flow grade 0 ; Spontaneously visible collateral , Rentrop classification grade 1 2 3 contralateral donor artery 6 . Presence minor intermediate coronary stenosis ( 170 % ) contralateral donor artery 7 . Eligible PCI chronic total occlusion ( CTO ) 1 . Previous CABG patent graft interrogate donor artery 2 . Left main stenosis > 40 % 3 . Presence severe flow limit stenosis contralateral donor artery ( typically > 70 % stenosis ) 4 . Haemodynamic instability time intervention ( heart rate < 40 beat per minute , systolic blood pressure < 90mmHg ) , balloon pump ) 5 . Significant contraindication adenosine administration ( e.g . heart block , severe asthma ) 6 . Contraindications PCI 7 . Severe hepatic lung disease ( chronic pulmonary obstructive disease ) 8 . Pregnancy 9 . ACS within 48 hour procedure 10 . Severe valvular heart disease 11 . Severe cardiomyopathy / Infiltrative heart disease 12. eGFR < 40
